Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

I inform Your Excellency that the Jacuí river was commanded by Furriel Joaquim Rodrigues, and the plan was foiled because the rebel Manuel Alz. marched with all forces to the coast of the Jacuí river.

The rebel José Romão Taborda, arrested in the previous sortie, was delivered under Your Excellency’s order.

God keep Your Excellency

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Tomás José da Silva. Marshal and Commander of the Garrison of Porto Alegre. Barracks in the town of Triunfo, February 16, 1845.

Antônio Pedro de Abreu  
Major in charge of gathering the ranks of the 8th Brigade.
